title: I owe IRS back taxes, penalties & interest.....
question: I am self employed, and as of now, I only have one client left @ $172.50/month. I have around $20k in savings. I do own a house (bank owns it), and have very little equity in it.
answers: you may wish to call a BK attorney. I recommend Steve Kremer at 415-292-7230. He will provide you with a free consultation.

Even the IRS has to play by some rules, and some of these rules are called exemptions, that can protect/diminish what property The IRS can take. Exemptions are often dependent on the state in which you live.

With $20,000 in savings, this would be a bad time to file bankruptcy unless those savings are actually exempt, such as being a 401(k) or an IRA account.

As other attorneys noted, income taxes can be discharged under certain circumstances in bankruptcy, ( I'm sure there is an Avvo legal guide on this issue somewhere).

The next tax year ends approximately 4/15/2012, this could be a factor in question of timing, if bankruptcy is necessary, and also question of negotiation tactics with the IRS.

Make sure the IRS has not recorded a tax lien. If the IRS has not recorded a tax lien and if the debt is three years old then you should strongly consider filing a chapter 7 to discharge those taxes. Generally the IRS won't take your car or your house. However, they will try to garnish your wages and place a lien on your property. Since you have about 20k savings and very little equity in your home, you might be able to claim the cash and equity as exempt in bankruptcy and keep it all. Too good to be true? Not really. It's in the law! Can you do it? Contact an AVVO bankruptcy attorney in your area and explain your situation. Given the information provided, I believe you can.

It depends on how old the debt is. If tax debt is over three years old, then you can discharge it in Chapter 7 bankruptcy. You may also be able to keep much of your savings, if your bankruptcy attorney knows what he or she is doing as for the claim of exemptions. Avvo has a tab to find attorneys by subject in your area.
